{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3480800,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-13T08:16:03.989Z","cooked":"

Hi folks!

After spending some time here on CD and listening to teams deal with user experience issues on the VH-109 radio, it was decided that we needed to create a utility to assist teams in configuring the network adapter, similar to how the old FRC radio configuration utility worked in years past.

frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net

Network Assistant Tool | FIRST FRC Radio

It specifically allows users to enable DHCP coexistence on their network adapter where you can have both a statically assigned IP address of 192.168.69.2/24 and a DHCP assigned address, enabling you to reach the configuration IP of the radio while still being able to use dynamically assigned team IP addresses.

We hope this helps teams with configuring their radios!

Fletch1373:

Even better… the SAME network interface with multiple IPs assigned

not quite! In 1.0.0, we only let it do DHCP and one static IP… we just pushed 1.0.1 that doesn’t care if you have one or 10 static IPs and or DHCP enabled.
